013package org.apache.juneau.assertions;
014
015import static java.util.Arrays.*;
016import static java.util.stream.Collectors.*;
017import static org.apache.juneau.internal.CollectionUtils.*;
018import static org.apache.juneau.internal.StringUtils.*;
019
020import java.io.*;
021import java.util.*;
022import java.util.function.*;
023
024import org.apache.juneau.cp.*;
025import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
026import org.apache.juneau.serializer.*;
027
028/**
029 * Used for fluent assertion calls against lists.
030 *
031 * <h5 class='topic'>Test Methods</h5>
032 * <p>
033 * <ul class='javatree'>
034 *    <li class='jc'>{@link FluentListAssertion}
035 *    <ul class='javatreec'>
036 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentListAssertion#isHas(Object...) isHas(Object...)}
037 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentListAssertion#isEach(Predicate...) isEach(Predicate...)}
038 *    </ul>
039 *    <li class='jc'>{@link FluentCollectionAssertion}
040 *    <ul class='javatreec'>
041 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentCollectionAssertion#isEmpty() isEmpty()}
042 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentCollectionAssertion#isNotEmpty() isNotEmpty()}
043 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentCollectionAssertion#isContains(Object) isContains(Object)}
044 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentCollectionAssertion#isNotContains(Object) isNotContains(Object)}
045 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentCollectionAssertion#isAny(Predicate) isAny(Predicate)}
046 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentCollectionAssertion#isAll(Predicate) isAll(Predicate)}
047 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentCollectionAssertion#isSize(int size) isSize(int size)}
048 *    </ul>
049 *    <li class='jc'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion}
050 *    <ul class='javatreec'>
051 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isExists() isExists()}
052 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#is(Object) is(Object)}
053 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#is(Predicate) is(Predicate)}
054 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isNot(Object) isNot(Object)}
055 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isAny(Object...) isAny(Object...)}
056 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isNotAny(Object...) isNotAny(Object...)}
057 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isNull() isNull()}
058 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isNotNull() isNotNull()}
059 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isString(String) isString(String)}
060 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isJson(String) isJson(String)}
061 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isSame(Object) isSame(Object)}
062 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isSameJsonAs(Object) isSameJsonAs(Object)}
063 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isSameSortedJsonAs(Object) isSameSortedJsonAs(Object)}
064 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isSameSerializedAs(Object, WriterSerializer) isSameSerializedAs(Object, WriterSerializer)}
065 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isType(Class) isType(Class)}
066 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isExactType(Class) isExactType(Class)}
067 *    </ul>
068 * </ul>
069 *
070 * <h5 class='topic'>Transform Methods</h5>
071 * <p>
072 * <ul class='javatree'>
073 *    <li class='jc'>{@link FluentListAssertion}
074 *    <ul class='javatreec'>
075 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentListAssertion#asStrings() asStrings()}
076 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentListAssertion#asStrings(Function) asStrings(Function)}
077 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentListAssertion#asCdl() asCdl()}
078 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentListAssertion#asCdl(Function) asCdl(Function)}
079 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentListAssertion#asItem(int) asItem(int)}
080 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentListAssertion#asSorted() asSorted()}
081 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentListAssertion#asSorted(Comparator) asSorted(Comparator)}
082 *    </ul>
083 *    <li class='jc'>{@link FluentCollectionAssertion}
084 *    <ul class='javatreec'>
085 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentCollectionAssertion#asStrings() asStrings()}
086 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentCollectionAssertion#asSize() asSize()}
087 *    </ul>
088*  <li class='jc'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion}
089 *    <ul class='javatreec'>
090 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#asString() asString()}
091 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#asString(WriterSerializer) asString(WriterSerializer)}
092 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#asString(Function) asString(Function)}
093 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#asJson() asJson()}
094 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#asJsonSorted() asJsonSorted()}
095 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#asTransformed(Function) asApplied(Function)}
096 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#asAny() asAny()}
097 * </ul>
098 * </ul>
099 *
100 * <h5 class='topic'>Configuration Methods</h5>
101 * <p>
102 * <ul class='javatree'>
103 *    <li class='jc'>{@link Assertion}
104 *    <ul class='javatreec'>
105 *       <li class='jm'>{@link Assertion#setMsg(String, Object...) setMsg(String, Object...)}
106 *       <li class='jm'>{@link Assertion#setOut(PrintStream) setOut(PrintStream)}
107 *       <li class='jm'>{@link Assertion#setSilent() setSilent()}
108 *       <li class='jm'>{@link Assertion#setStdOut() setStdOut()}
109 *       <li class='jm'>{@link Assertion#setThrowable(Class) setThrowable(Class)}
110 *    </ul>
111 * </ul>
112 *
113 * <ul class='seealso'>
114 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-assertions.ja.Overview">Overview &gt; juneau-assertions &gt; Overview</a>
115 * </ul>
116 *
117 * @param <E> The element type.
118 * @param <R> The return type.
119 */
120@FluentSetters(returns="FluentListAssertion<E,R>")
121public class FluentListAssertion<E,R> extends FluentCollectionAssertion<E,R> {
122
123   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
124   // Static
125   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
126
127   private static final Messages MESSAGES = Messages.of(FluentListAssertion.class, "Messages");
128   private static final String
129      MSG_listDidNotContainExpectedValueAt = MESSAGES.getString("listDidNotContainExpectedValueAt");
130
131   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
132   // Instance
133   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
134
135   /**
136    * Constructor.
137    *
138    * @param value
139    *    The object being tested.
140    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
141    * @param returns
142    *    The object to return after a test method is called.
143    *    <br>If <jk>null</jk>, the test method returns this object allowing multiple test method calls to be
144    * used on the same assertion.
145    */
146   public FluentListAssertion(List<E> value, R returns) {
147      this(null, value, returns);
148   }
149
150   /**
151    * Chained constructor.
152    *
153    * <p>
154    * Used when transforming one assertion into another so that the assertion config can be used by the new assertion.
155    *
156    * @param creator
157    *    The assertion that created this assertion.
158    *    <br>Should be <jk>null</jk> if this is the top-level assertion.
159    * @param value
160    *    The object being tested.
161    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
162    * @param returns
163    *    The object to return after a test method is called.
164    *    <br>If <jk>null</jk>, the test method returns this object allowing multiple test method calls to be
165    * used on the same assertion.
166    */
167   public FluentListAssertion(Assertion creator, List<E> value, R returns) {
168      super(creator, value, returns);
169   }
170
171   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
172   // Transform methods
173   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
174
175   /**
176    * Applies a transform on the inner object and returns a new inner object.
177    *
178    * @param function The transform to apply.
179    * @return A new assertion.
180    */
181   public FluentListAssertion<E,R> asApplied2(Function<List<E>,List<E>> function) {
182      return new FluentListAssertion<>(this, function.apply((List<E>)orElse(null)), returns());
183   }
184
185   /**
186    * Returns an object assertion on the item specified at the specified index.
187    *
188    * <p>
189    * If the list is <jk>null</jk> or the index is out-of-bounds, the returned assertion is a null assertion
190    * (meaning {@link FluentAnyAssertion#isExists()} returns <jk>false</jk>).
191    *
192    * @param index The index of the item to retrieve from the list.
193    * @return A new assertion.
194    */
195   public FluentAnyAssertion<E,R> asItem(int index) {
196      return new FluentAnyAssertion<>(this, at(index), returns());
197   }
198
199   /**
200    * Sorts the entries in this list.
201    *
202    * @return A new list assertion.  The contents of the original list remain unchanged.
203    */
204   public FluentListAssertion<E,R> asSorted() {
205      return new FluentListAssertion<>(this, toSortedList(null), returns());
206   }
207
208   /**
209    * Sorts the entries in this list using the specified comparator.
210    *
211    * @param comparator The comparator to use to sort the list.
212    * @return A new list assertion.  The contents of the original list remain unchanged.
213    */
214   public FluentListAssertion<E,R> asSorted(Comparator<E> comparator) {
215      return new FluentListAssertion<>(this, toSortedList(comparator), returns());
216   }
217
218   /**
219    * Returns the first entry from this list.
220    *
221    * @return A new list assertion.
222    */
223   public FluentAnyAssertion<E,R> asFirst() {
224      return asItem(0);
225   }
226
227   /**
228    * Returns the last entry from this list.
229    *
230    * @return A new list assertion.
231    */
232   public FluentAnyAssertion<E,R> asLast() {
233      return asItem(getSize()-1);
234   }
235
236   /**
237    * Returns the first X number of entries from this list.
238    *
239    * @param count The number of entries in the list to retrieve.
240    * @return A new list assertion.  The contents of the original list remain unchanged.
241    */
242   public FluentListAssertion<E,R> asFirst(int count) {
243      return new FluentListAssertion<>(this, valueIsNull() ? null : value().subList(0, count), returns());
244   }
245
246   /**
247    * Returns the first X number of entries from this list.
248    *
249    * @param count The number of entries in the list to retrieve.
250    * @return A new list assertion.  The contents of the original list remain unchanged.
251    */
252   public FluentListAssertion<E,R> asLast(int count) {
253      return new FluentListAssertion<>(this, valueIsNull() ? null : value().subList(getSize()-count, getSize()), returns());
254   }
255
256   /**
257    * Returns a sublist of the entries in this list.
258    *
259    * @param start The start index (inclusive).
260    * @param end The end index (exclusive).
261    * @return A new list assertion.  The contents of the original list remain unchanged.
262    */
263   public FluentListAssertion<E,R> asSublist(int start, int end) {
264      return new FluentListAssertion<>(this, valueIsNull() ? null : value().subList(start, end), returns());
265   }
266
267   /**
268    * Runs the stringify function against all values in this list and returns it as a fluent string list assertion.
269    *
270    * @param function The function to apply to all values in this list.
271    * @return A new fluent string list assertion.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
272    */
273   public FluentStringListAssertion<R> asStrings(Function<E,String> function) {
274      List<String> l = valueIsNull() ? null : value().stream().map(x -> function.apply(x)).collect(toList());
275      return new FluentStringListAssertion<>(this, l, returns());
276   }
277
278   /**
279    * Converts the entries in this list to a simple comma-delimited list and returns the value as a fluent string assertion.
280    *
281    * @return A fluent string assertion.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
282    */
283   public FluentStringAssertion<R> asCdl() {
284      return new FluentStringAssertion<>(this, valueIsNull() ? null : StringUtils.join(value(), ','), returns());
285   }
286
287   /**
288    * Converts the entries to strings using the specified stringify function, combines them into a simple comma-delimited list, and returns the value as a fluent string assertion.
289    *
290    * @param function The function to apply to all values in this list.
291    * @return A fluent string assertion.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
292    */
293   public FluentStringAssertion<R> asCdl(Function<E,String> function) {
294      List<String> l = valueIsNull() ? null : value().stream().map(x -> function.apply(x)).collect(toList());
295      return new FluentStringAssertion<>(this, join(l, ','), returns());
296   }
297
298   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
299   // Test methods
300   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
301
302   /**
303    * Asserts that the contents of this list contain the specified values.
304    *
305    * @param entries The expected entries in this list.
306    * @return The fluent return object.
307    * @throws AssertionError If assertion failed.
308    */
309   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
310   public R isHas(E...entries) throws AssertionError {
311      Predicate<E>[] p = stream(entries).map(AssertionPredicates::eq).toArray(Predicate[]::new);
312      return isEach(p);
313   }
314
315   /**
316    * Asserts that the contents of this list pass the specified tests.
317    *
318    * @param tests
319    *    The tests to run.
320    * <jk>null</jk> predicates are ignored.
321    * @return The fluent return object.
322    * @throws AssertionError If assertion failed.
323    */
324   @SafeVarargs
325   public final R isEach(Predicate<E>...tests) throws AssertionError {
326      isSize(tests.length);
327      for (int i = 0, j = getSize(); i < j; i++) {
328         Predicate<E> t = tests[i];
329         if (t != null && ! t.test(at(i)))
330            throw error(MSG_listDidNotContainExpectedValueAt, i, getFailureMessage(t, at(i)));
331      }
332      return returns();
333   }
334
335   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
336   // Fluent setters
337   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
338
339   // <FluentSetters>
340
341   @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertion */
342   public FluentListAssertion<E,R> setMsg(String msg, Object...args) {
343      super.setMsg(msg, args);
344      return this;
345   }
346
347   @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertion */
348   public FluentListAssertion<E,R> setOut(PrintStream value) {
349      super.setOut(value);
350      return this;
351   }
352
353   @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertion */
354   public FluentListAssertion<E,R> setSilent() {
355      super.setSilent();
356      return this;
357   }
358
359   @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertion */
360   public FluentListAssertion<E,R> setStdOut() {
361      super.setStdOut();
362      return this;
363   }
364
365   @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertion */
366   public FluentListAssertion<E,R> setThrowable(Class<? extends java.lang.RuntimeException> value) {
367      super.setThrowable(value);
368      return this;
369   }
370
371   // </FluentSetters>
372
373   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
374   // Utility methods
375   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
376
377   @Override
378   protected List<E> value() throws AssertionError {
379      return (List<E>)super.value();
380   }
381
382   private E at(int index) throws AssertionError {
383      return valueIsNull() || index < 0 || index >= getSize() ? null : value().get(index);
384   }
385
386   private List<E> toSortedList(Comparator<E> comparator) {
387      return valueIsNull() ? null : sortedList(comparator, value());
388   }
389}
